text: Yukio Mishima was the writer's name used by was a Japanese writer, poet, playwright, actor and film director.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Mishima Yukio" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 640. One of his close friends was Yasunari Kawabata. On November 25, 1970, he tried to make a coup d'état for military force but in vain and killed himself via seppuku. ==Early life== Mishima studied at the elite . When he was child, he stuttered. In 1941, Mishima wrote his first notable story. In , he described a feeling that his ancestors lived within him. Mishima graduated from the University of Tokyo in 1947. ==Career== Mishima worked in the Japanese Ministry of Finance. At the same time, he was writing.Shabecoff, Philip. "Mishima: A Man Torn Between Two Worlds," New York Times. November 26, 1970; retrieved 2012-6-8.
